author: A_Brickset_user
title: nice little set.
review:
this is a set with few pieces. it is:
a 4x8 yellow baseplate
a black 1x1x2 piece with a hole in the side
a large green moss piece
8 "Pieces of Eight"
1 bluecoat pirate with an eyepatch, black hair, a brown tricorne hat and grey pants
1 British (red) captain (red uniform, white pants, black hair and facial hair, black tricorne
a treasure chest
Happyness!

author: Gus_263
title: Little cool
review: This set is really so much like the other small pirates sets. The two figures included have a nice design and also simple, in a classic lego style. Are a pirate and a soldier. The both have their different hats and design. This set is too easy to build, and is basically some small yellow plates combination with a treassure in a chest with plants and including two minifigures and their accessories. The playability is good and basic. The color scheme is also awesome and the set is sometimes cool to play, but the best to do is make a creation combining with some other lego pirates theme sets. Overall this small set is nice but with no innovations and few pieces. It still good, so i rate the pirates plunder 4/5

author: AETerry
title: More treasure over here captain!
review:
This set is very similiar to the Buried Treasure set and also within it's price range. It manages to narrowly avoid reducancy by offering a different mix up of minifigures in the set. A Pirate mate sporting the brown tricorne hats and one of the Red Imperial Soldiers along with a parrot.

 

At the same time, the set still offers a cheap easy way to get ahold of Pirates for your sets, treasure chest with gold coins, accessories and a parrot this time. And once again it's value and playability comes out with its size, pricing and ability to add it to other sets to enhance and extend out play.
